Text.Value: Just allow me to leave. I'm no threat to you or your cub.
Scars don't make us kindred, softmeat. And they don't make you welcome in my nest.
Move closer.
Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

EditorData.stateContext: Player stands in the Owlbear Cave as the creature steps in front of the player

Text.Value: Come, then. Once I've plucked you, I'll have your cub for dessert.
*The owlbear's one good eye flicks away for a moment. You follow its glance...*
*...You can leave now, or step closer and die.*
Puff out your chest and roar.
Hold out your palms - you mean no harm.
A fight? You'd be a plaything - not worth the trouble.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's injured, and she knows it. This is a fight she might not win - but she can't let the player know that.

Text.Value: Step closer.
*...and see an owlbear cub.*
*The beast shrinks back, feathers quivering.*
That eye - or lack of it - must have you in a lot of pain. I should know.
*The owlbear growls deep in its feathered chest - you had your chance.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Owlbear claws come out, threatening stance
EditorData.NodeContext: A wild animal bellows and turns hostile after the player ignores its previous demands to leave its territory.

Text.Value: My cub must learn how to deal with a threat. How to make it fear.
COME - FIGHT!
*As you retreat, the owlbear lets out a short huff. The message is clear...*
Attack.
You're injured - there's still half a spear lodged in your head.
You can go. But you make one wrong step, and I'll rip you to shreds.
*You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player doesn't have Speak with Animals.

Text.Value: *It sits back, its eyes still fixed on you. A silent ultimatum...*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Owlbear shuffles back while looking forward

Text.Value: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player has speak with Animals.

Text.Value: I don't think so. You've seen my nest. You've seen my cub.
The meat tastes better when it's afraid.
Should've listened when you had the chance.
It's a splinter. I've gutted bigger threats than you with worse.

EditorData.NodeContext: She has a spear sticking out of her eye.

Text.Value: *Schrrreek!*
Stop! One more step and I'll rip your throat out.
You've had your last meal, beast. You and your cub alike.
*The owlbear stares, then sharply inhales your scent.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: owlbear stares, sharply inhales scent, [reuse]Player couple steps forward

Text.Value: Move toward the cub.
You need rest - let nature heal you. This is no time for a fight.
*The owlbear stares, but doesn't move to attack. The way out seems clear.*
Oh, yes? What're you waiting for?
You'll be missing more than your eye before I'm done.
Brave. Stupid, but brave. And I'm too tired to deal with brave.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's injured, and she knows it. This is a fight she might not win - but she can't let the player know that.

Text.Value: A mistake that would cost your life - if you posed any real danger.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's injured, and she knows it. This is a fight she might not win - but she can't let the player know that.

Text.Value: *It sits back, its eye still fixed on you. A silent ultimatum...*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Owlbear shuffles back while looking forward

Text.Value: Sorry - wrong cave. I'll be going.
What's this? Something weak, something tender...
*A bloodthirsty screech erupts from the owlbear's throat.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Owlbears lands slash on player, digging deep and rears back for another attack, [reuse]Player couple steps forward

Text.Value: Back away.
Thanks to you, I'm healed enough to cut you from belly to snout.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She is healed here - has both good eyes and is about to go aggro on the player

Text.Value: A mistake you won't escape.
*Growl.*
*Huff.*

EditorData.NodeContext: A deep huff - the owlbear is considering its next move.

Text.Value: Back away slowly.
I've still got one good eye. That's all I need.
You'll be even less of a threat when you're in pieces.
*The owlbear glances quickly back, then squares its gaze at you. You follow its glance...*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The owlbear glances toward the cubs.

Text.Value: Study the owlbear's behaviour.
*The beast returns the roar in kind.*
That makes you dangerous. An easy meal.
*Hoo-hoot!*
Let me go, or you'll watch your cub die before I finish you.
You're small. Weak. Killing you would be a waste of time.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's injured, and she knows it. This is a fight she might not win - but she can't let the player know that.

Text.Value: I would never intrude on your nest knowingly. This was a simple mistake.
ROAR.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Barbarian tagged variant of N1529 with advantage

Text.Value: Attack.
*You can only surmise the obvious - the owlbear is out for blood.*
No need for that - I'll just leave.
*You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*
I warned you, softmeat. You don't listen.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Owlbear claws come out, threatening stance
EditorData.NodeContext: A wild animal bellows and turns hostile after the player ignores its previous demands to leave its territory.

Text.Value: I'll tear you in half before you touch a feather on his head.

Synopsis:
In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.

The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.
Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.
Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
